fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42227].
  {panel}

At the moment, accented characters are treated separately from normal characters when using a mention. This would be a problem if there are many users who use accented characters in their names.

An example would be as follow. Let's assume this instance have many users with the first name *Adam*, with different last names. It would be very hard to mention a person whose name is *Adam Lündy* since the mention only shows 5 results according to alphabetical order, and it is not as easy to type with accented characters.

!1.png|thumbnail!
!2.png|thumbnail!
!3.png|thumbnail!

By treating accented characters same as normal characters, then you can easily mention *Adam Lündy* by typing *@adam lu*
fields.summary: Allow @mention to treat accented characters (Féäther) as normal characters (Feather)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42225].
  {panel}

In JIRA, you are able to arrange Versions for a project. This affects what order the versions are shown in drop-down lists and also how 'version' type fields are sorted. 

The drop and drag functionality provided by the User Interface does not allow creating a version into a specific location, or automatically sorting this list using any criteria.

Projects with very long lists become difficult to manage. For example, imagine having many concurrent version releases being actively developed and needing to add a point release due to a security patch on each version. The Project Administrator would need to drag through the list all the new project versions to their correct locations.

Controls such as: Automatically Sorting the list by Version Number and allowing a user to define a specific "versionAfter" version when creating a new version would greatly aid in the usability of the product.
fields.summary: Managing and Sorting Versions needs better controls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42224].
  {panel}

When using the "Basic Search" feature, Issue Search is able to 'hide' fields which are irrelevant for the specified project. 

Within Advanced Search, it would be good if the Autocomplete feature could review the existing conditions defined in the JQL and hide or grey out fields that are irrelevant for the current search. 

One specific example is when a customer has many Custom Fields with the same name but different types within different projects. When the user attempts to use JQL in the Advanced search, Autocomplete suggests all the different fields with the same, and this makes the product difficult to use, even though a project has been defined within the JQL query.

Hiding fields which are not relevant to the current search context would make the product more user friendly.
fields.summary: Advanded Search Autocomplete filter suggestion based on existing search terms in Query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42223].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing an issue in JIRA, you are presented all the fields that are associated with a screen. I know you can display/hide fields by making a new screen and then associating with a workflow transition. However, I would also like this to reflect on the main page when viewing an issue.

h3. Example
An example would be on Create Issue you are presented with fields such as Zip Code, Phone Number, State and, City. So after creating the issue with these fields containing values, you will see these fields on the main page for viewing an issue. However, let's say I'm on a transition/status called "Shipped" and the screen for that transition does not contain the fields Zip Code, Phone, Number, State and City. I want that to be reflected on the main page thus hiding those fields.
fields.summary: Ability To Define/Set Field Visibility Based on Workflow Transition/Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42215].
  {panel}

We'd like to be able to reference existing commits in Stash that introduced a bug, into the comments and description of the subsequent bug reports.

For example, we get a bug report, a developer looks at the commit history and finds the specific commit(s) where the bug was introduced and wants to discuss the commits with his colleagues. Right now he can type this by hand: {code}[73e778e|http://stash.example.com/stash/projects/PRJ/repos/project/commits/73e778ed40bf0384e7531712e9c92e08bb815472#src/main/webapp/app/controller/Controller.js]{code} to create a link like [73e778e|http://stash.example.com/stash/projects/PRJ/repos/project/commits/73e778ed40bf0384e7531712e9c92e08bb815472#src/main/webapp/app/controller/Controller.js]

We can already just type JIRA issue keys into comments and JIRa automatically transforms them into clickable links to those issues. It would be useful if we can just type 73e778e or 73e778e:src/main/webapp/app/controller/Controller.js and have JIRA automatically link it to the commit in Stash and even the specific file in that commit, respectively.

Perhaps with a different notation so that the parser can more easily pick it up as a commit id, something like #73e778e and #73e778e:<path> for specific files in that commit.
fields.summary: Allow linking Stash (git) commits by their SHA in JIRA comments and descriptions

Fluid.app could make a web based application to have a separate client or application rather than packed in one web browser.

Using Fluid.app it's a great help to be quickly able to switch between apps, without having to find the correct tab in whatever browser you happen to be using today. Rather than looking for the correct tab in web browser or have a lot of separate windows for each Atlassian Products, using this app we could just hit CMD+Tab a few times and we will be on where we want to be.

Using this app integration also could help to keep tracks on what we are working on.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42196].
  {panel}

As stated in [JIRA text search documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-reserved], certain reserved words are treated by stop words by lucene and not included in the Search Indexes, making it impossible to search with them in the text search. e.g. a", "and", "are", "as", "at", "be", "but" and "by" to name a few. The idea of this is to avoid performance issues.

This becomes a major limitation in use cases where one of these words coincide with a string which represents an important search sting in a JIRA instance e.g. a code or acronym (for one customer BY is an IATA code which is a custom field value and used in the summaries of JIRA tickets as well). In this cases it's a major inconvenience and source of confusion for users who are not getting expected results when searching with this strings because they are treated as stop words by lucene.

Not sure what would be the best way to implement a solution for this problem, but perhaps we can implement a way to automatically modify the text to an exact search string by adding quotes automatically when a reserved word is used in search. e.g.:
basically {{text ~ "by"}} becomes {{text ~ "\"by\""}} automatically, so that the search doesn't fail.
fields.summary: Handling lucene reserved words in text search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42182].
  {panel}

Our business users have found that is too hard for them to navigate thru a large number of issues because they cannot jump to pages efficiently.
The page control that allows users to pick a page shows only 5 pages, and if you want to jump to page 10 you have to click on the control 5 times, 
and everytime you have to scroll to the bottom to be able to click on the next set.If we increase the number of issues shown in each page, then the user
has to scroll even longer to reach the control.
Business users request that:
a) we move the page control to the top of the page, so that the number of issues per page can be increased without having to scroll more
b) we increase the number of pages to 21, so that you can move up or down 10 pages in one shot
When reviewing the java code we found that in the file:
jira-project\jira-components\jira-api\main\java\com\atlassian\jira\issue\search\SearchResults.java
the parameter that controls the limits in the page restriction is hardcoded to 5 pages:
private static final int PAGES_TO_LIST = 5;
We also see that in the pager control is created in the footer template:
jira-project/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/templates/jira/issue/table/issuetable-footer.vm
But it could have been easily added to the header template instead:
jira-project/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/templates/jira/issue/table/issuetable-header.vm

Can you look at the above requests and determine if you could:
a) Allow users to configure in their preferences page the number of pages to be shown in the search result, similar to how it is already done for the number of issues per page?
b) Allow user to determine if the page navigator is shown in the footer or in the header of the search page?

We believe that the above improvement will help everyone.
Thank you for your help on this issue,
Reynaldo
fields.summary: Configure the restriction limit of the number of pages to list control shown at the bottom the Issue search result page

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42172].
  {panel}

At the moment, in JIRA Services (g + g + Services), the only option available as of right now is to specify a delay.

As the users understand it, a service will run upon creation/modification of the service, and then run again (and again and so forth) every time $delay minutes have passed. Same goes for JIRA startup - run initially, and then again every time the delay has passed.

Contrast that with Confluence's "Scheduled Jobs", where, for at least some of them, it is possible to specify execution times like one does with Cron on *nix systems - in the case of the specific client I had in mind (who is not alone in this), it would be beneficial to specify, for instance 0 20 * * * for one service, 5 20 * * * for another, 10 20 * * * for a third etc., for execution every day at 20:00 for the first, 20:05 for the second, 20:10 for the third and so forth.

To summarise, the Cron-like ability for scheduling jobs in Confluence is great, and it would be very nice to have similar capabilities in JIRA.
fields.summary: Improvement for JIRA Services (following how Schedule Jobs works in Confluence)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42167].
  {panel}

I am constantly doing various JQL searches in the issue navigator, and depending on what I'm searching for I have different preferences for which columns I want to view in the Issue Navigator. 
Such, as when I'm looking at outstanding defects, or outstanding requests, or looking at priority of request, etc. etc.  
It time consuming and annoying to constantly have to change the columns display.
For me I would like to save a few templates, that I could use for my various searches depending on what I'm searching for.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Power User I would like the ability to save different "List ViewTemplates" to switch between displayed columns in the  "List VIew" of the Issue Navigator more effeciently
Adding components to feedback is broken.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42165].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Entering a regex longer than 255 chars will throw an error in the JIRA log files, but there is no front end validation for the length of the mail handler regex

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA set up an Incoming Mail server
# Create a new Mail Handler of type _"Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"_
# Fill out the *Split Regex* field to be longer than 255 chars
# Click *add* and there will be an error in the JIRA log file

h3. Expected Results
If it is intended that JIRA does not accept more than 255 chars in the regex string an error on the UI should be thrown.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:

This is because of how OvBiz works https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11075

h3.Workaround
There is no simple workaround for this bug unless:
* The regex is condensed down to 255 chars
* The AbstractPropertySet class is changed to accept over 255 chars (this is not supported by atlassian support however and would be done at your own risk).
fields.summary: JIRA Mail Handler field does not accept more than 255 chars
Customise when Link Issue is allowed
Configureable scope for "text" search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42161].
  {panel}

Customer is looking to show on Issue Pages, in the Time Tracking section, Negative Values on "Time Remaining" if they go over the Estimated Value.

For Example, Issue is estimated for 3 hours but work done is 4 hours; remaining time will show as 0 m:
!TimeTracking.png|thumbnail!. 

Customer would like to see this represented as -1 hrs on the Issue pages.
fields.summary: Show Negative Remaining Time on Issues for Going Over Estimates
Rename "Time to Resolution" field
Allow Customization Of Pie Chart Gadget Colors

Today it's not possible to jump between applications within a project, by just clicking on the project avatar. 

Usually we would see the links to the other applications. Today it does nothing.

E.g.:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42150].
  {panel}

In the new JIRA versions, the Issue Type view under Administration console has changed and it now also shows the workflows next to the Fields view. This is confusing for a user.

Clicking on the Issuetype takes a user to the workflow. This is a bit surprising. Please change this to make it more intuitive.

*Steps to reproduce :* 
* Navigate to _Administration>>Project>>Issue Type_ then click on any IssueType

PS : The tab remembers the history. So if a user has been to the workflow tab the last time, then the workflow tab would be selected for the next time.
fields.summary: Issue type view under administration console is not very intuitive
Paste doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 7-Dec-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi, Everyone! This issue was reported a while ago and the version were this was being experienced (Jira 6.3.14) has reached [End of life|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html] with no additional cases being found. As a validation we have tried to reproduce the issue in the latest Jira 7.13 and the error does not seem to be showing in the logs anymore. From these results we will proceed to close this bug as Obsolete.

If anyone is able to replicate the bug reported here in a supported Jira version (7.3 at the time of this update), please let us know, including the steps to reproduce in the comments or by raising a support request.

Best regards,
René Chiquete - JAC Champion.
{panel}

h3. Issue summary
Email notification sends errors after customized priorities were deleted

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Add a new priority
# Create any issue and assign that newly created priority to the issue
# Change the priority to a another priority in that issue
# Delete the newly created priority

h3. Expected Result:
Email notification sent would show the value changed in the issue (issue updated)

h3. Actual Result:
- An email notification will be sent for issue updated, showing this error message
{code}

fields.description:
When used via the command line, the JIRA Configuration Tool will ask for the SID in Oracle instead of the Service Name, however, the tool uses the SID as the Service Name on the Connection String:
{noformat}
Database Selection [P]> O
Oracle Database Configuration.
Hostname ()> hostname
Port ()> port
SID ()> SID
Username ()> user
Password ()>
Test Connection  ([Y]/N)? > n

--- Database Selection ---
  Database Type : Oracle
  Instance      : hostname:port/SID
  Connect As    : user / *****
{noformat}

The resulting connection string will look as below, in which SID is placed where the Service Name is expected:
{code:xml|title=dbconfig.xml}
(...)
<url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@//hostname:port/SID</url>
(...)
{code}

This problem does not occur in the GUI version of the Configuration Tool.
We should replace the text from *SID* to *Service / Service Name* as this is misleading to customers.

References:
- http://www.orafaq.com/wiki/JDBC
- http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/java.111/b31224/urls.htm#BEIDHCBA
fields.summary: The Console JIRA Configuration Tool should ask for Service Name instead of SID for Oracle DBs

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When trying to export *more than 1000* issues to PDF (functionality came from [Agile Cards plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.spartez.scrumprint.scrumplugin]), JIRA's Forbidden (403) page is garbled. Only happened when GZIP compression is enabled

h4. Environment
Tested on JIRA 6.2.7, 6.3.15, with Agile Cards 2.3.16

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Agile Cards
# Enable GZIP Compression in *General Configuration* page
# Create more than 1000 issues
# From *Issue Navigator*, use a JQL that will return more than 1000 issues 
# Click the *Export > Agile Cards (PDF)* button

h4. Expected Results
Forbidden (403) page will be shown, as it has exceed the 1000 default issue export limit in JIRA
!Forbidden_403.png!

h4. Actual Results
Garbled message is presented
!403.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
* This only happened when GZIP compression is enabled
* Page is shown correctly when GZIP compression is disabled

h4. Questions
What is causing JIRA GZIP compression to convert the page into garbled character?
fields.summary: JIRA Forbidden (403) page is garbled when using Agile Cards plugin and GZIP compression enabled

fields.description:
Looping {{replicatedindexoperation}} messages for DELETE operations, which result in the table growing to a massive size.
h4. Impact

Only affects Data Center. If the table grows to an overwhelming size, queries may timeout and replication could fail

Could also result in:
{code:java}
2016-03-16 09:12:13,284 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 WARN      [ofbiz.core.entity.SequenceUtil] [SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.fillBank] SQL Exception
java.sql.SQLException: Numeric overflow in conversion of value 2,147,483,700 to type INTEGER.
        at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Support.convert(Support.java:300)
        at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsResultSet.getInt(JtdsResultSet.java:656)
        at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsResultSet.getInt(JtdsResultSet.java:983)

{code}
{code:java}
2016-09-29 20:05:05,900 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR [jira.index.ha.DefaultReplicatedIndexManager] Caught an exception trying to replicate deindexed shared entity. The replicated index may or may not be correct
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ReplicatedIndexOperation][indexTime,2016-09-29 20:05:05.809][filename,][entityType,SEARCH_REQUEST][affectedIndex,SHAREDENTITY][affectedIds,xxxx][id,null][operation,DELETE][nodeId,node5] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO replicatedindexoperation (ID, INDEX_TIME, NODE_ID, AFFECTED_INDEX, ENTITY_TYPE, AFFECTED_IDS, OPERATION, FILENAME) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ORA-01400: cannot insert NULL into ("<oracle_schema>"."REPLICATEDINDEXOPERATION"."ID")
))
{code}
h4. Workaround
 # Reduce the retention period of the records
 ** Administration > Services > Replicated index flush service
 ** Edit this service and reduce the retention period
 (i) This would not stop the loop, but will help keep the table in a more manageable size
fields.summary: Looping DELETE operation messages in replicatedindexoperation

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update 23 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your comments and feedback, we really appreciate your engagement. We've made the decision to close this issue because we want to send a clear message that this is not something JIRA is going to support.

First, a few thoughts on this issue in particular.
* JIRA permission schemes are already very granular and complex. There are several dozen individual permissions that an administrator needs to understand. If these different sets of permissions were mapped at the issue type level, this would multiply the complexity.
* In our research, we already see major confusion between schemes that map configuration to issue types versus schemes that map configuration to projects.
** Issue type schemes, permissions, notifications, and issue security are all associated directly to a *project*
** Workflow schemes, field configuration schemes, and issue type screen schemes map configuration to *issue types*
* If you were to change the behavior of permission schemes so that they mapped a permission configuration to issue types, you would need to introduce a second layer – a permission configuration per issue type, and then a permission scheme to associate that set of configurations to a project.
* This is the exact opposite of the direction we want to go with JIRA. We are investing heavily in reducing complexity in JIRA administration to make it more accessible to more users.

This does not mean that the needs of JIRA admins are not important. Improving performance and simplifying project configuration are the top two priorities for the JIRA development team for the foreseeable future. However, when looking holistically at how we can improve the project configuration experience in JIRA, this request doesn't fit in to our vision.

A note on requests on jira.atlassian.com:
* We take the feedback and votes on feature requests on jira.atlassian.com seriously. Certainly the fact that there's 144 votes for this request and it's already been closed before doesn't go unnoticed.
* When we make the decision to close an issue, our goal is to make a clear statement about which features we realistically expect to support in JIRA and which features we don't expect to implement, at least not in the way they have been described in the feature request. While it might be painful or frustrating in the short term, we strongly committed to communicating our intentions as openly as possible. Everyone is better off in the long run.
* We have a detailed explanation of how we use jira.atlassian.com and how we develop our roadmap [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

We're currently in the midst of updating almost every feature request in the JRA project with a significant number of votes. Our hope is that the conclusion you draw is not that Atlassian doesn't care, but that we are trying to focus on the improvements that will the largest benefit for the most customers, and unfortunately this means that we simply cannot work on the vast majority of the hundreds of feature requests at once.

Feel free to contact me at any time if you have feedback or questions. My email address is dmeyer@atlassian.com.

Thanks,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA
{panel}

Reopen JRA-5865 created 10 years ago. I understand the reason why you didn't implement this but there's a LOT or people and company wanting this feature. There's still a lot of activity on the issue comment.

Please reconsider implementing this feature.

Now, when a group has the permission to create an issue, it could create EVERY types of issues available. It's a complement to project specific issues types. (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1602)

For example, If we have external client (like me right now :)) I would be interrested to limit his issue creation right to only bugs, features, external client requests (custom type).
fields.summary: Reopen 5865 : Allow permission schemes to be configured per issue type

fields.description:
Currently, AUI forms with a file input  seem to need an 'id' attribute to stop a runtime javascript failure that breaks all other scripts. 

Lack of an 'id' element, or adding with/without a value but not being a valid issueID/projectID results in a javascript console error:
{quote}Uncaught Unable to find either an issueId or projectId to submit the attachment to.{quote}

Odd behaviour then occurs if there is already an 'id' form attribute on submit that, a new file picker element dynamically injected, with some related text, which is not desirable.

# This requirement is asserted on all forms but should only apply to JIRA forms with a specific class selector for the cases that need it (there isn't one)
# Usage of 'id' with no prefix is an [undocumented|https://docs.atlassian.com/aui/latest/docs/forms.html] requirement for forms with file sections.  'id' is too generic, and is likely to be  already used, and should be something else, 'relatedIssueOrProjectId' for example.  If this script targeted applicable forms appropriately, the use of 'id' or not would not matter
# The related script should detect lack of presence of a more appropriately named required attribute rather than breaking
fields.summary: javascript error - Uncaught Unable to find either an issueId or projectId to submit the attachment to
